name: EA-011-Arendt
description:
Hannah Arendt (1906 - 1975 aC) was a German political philosopher of Jewish origin, one of the most influential of the 20th century.One of Hannah Arendt's key concepts is known to have been established while the author journalistically covered the trials of former Nazi officials that began in 1961 in the city of Jerusalem when she wrote her important work Eichmann in Jerusalem. The concept of the "banality of evil" is about what she calls the "uprooting" of human experiences from reality, from amorality, from subservience to orders, from acriticism. A quote from the book The Origins of Totalitarianism, which talks about the structure of the totalitarian movement

Digital Watercolor Vector Illustration made in Adobe Photoshop, 1200x1200px, 200dpi, JPEG, 2021
